newsitem.title: USA: Five Illinois counties to vote on tax caps.
newsitem.headline: Five Illinois counties to vote on tax caps.

text.p: Voters in five Illinois counties will vote on property tax limitations next Tuesday, according to the State Board of Elections.

Adams, McDonough, McLean, Shelby and Stephenson counties have placed measures on the ballot to limit annual increases in local property tax collections to five percent or the rate of inflation, whichever is less.
The limitation would also prohibit the issuance of general obligation bonds without voter approval.

Last November, voters in 18 out of 19 counties that placed the measure on the ballot approved tax caps. A 1996 state law allowed 96 counties outside of the Chicago area to decide whether to hold a vote on tax caps.
Prior to the passage of the law, tax caps were put in place by the General Assembly in six Chicago area counties.
